intro: Mazaea pungens, commonly known as the stinging mazaca, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish in color. Its most notable feature is the presence of stinging hairs on the leaves and stems, which can cause irritation upon contact. Mazaea pungens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
